questions.text: is a common name present?
sub_questions: if not, is the product exempt from common name?

questions.text: is the common name on the principal display panel (PDP)?
is the common name in letters of 1.6 mm or greater?
sub_questions: or, if the area of the principal display surface (PDS) is 10 cm2 (1.55 inches2) or less, is the common name shown in characters with a minimum type height of 0.8 mm (1/32 inch)?

questions.text: is it an appropriate common name?
sub_questions: as printed in bold face type, but not in italics, in the FDR or in the Canadian Standards of Identity documents incorporated by reference (IbR) in the SFCR
as prescribed by any other regulation
the name by which the food is generally known or a name that is not generic and that describes the food, if the name is not so printed or prescribed, or
if the food is likely to be mistaken for another food, the common name must include words that describe the food's true nature with respect to its condition

questions.text: is a net quantity declaration present?
sub_questions: if not, is the product exempt from net quantity?

questions.text: is the net quantity declared on the PDP?
is it in metric units?
sub_questions: or, in metric or Canadian units if it is a consumer prepackaged food that is packaged from bulk at retail, other than an individually measured food?

questions.text: is the appropriate manner (volume, weight, count) for the product used?
is it rounded to 3 figures, unless below 100?
are the correct bilingual symbols used? (for example, ml, mL, mℓ, L, l, ℓ for liquids; g, kg for solids)
sub_questions: if not, and the units are written out (for example, kilograms), are the units declared in both languages (unless exempt from bilingual labelling)?

questions.text: does the size of the numerical portion meet the minimum type height requirements (based on size of PDS)? Is it in bold face type? Are the units in letters of 1.6 mm or greater (based on lowercase 'o')?
if optional Canadian units are also present, are they declared properly?
if optional U.S. gallons and quarts are also present, are they identified properly? (fl oz optional)

list_of_ingredients.title: List of Ingredients and Allergen Labelling

questions.text: is a list of ingredients present?
sub_questions: if not, is the product exempt from declaring a list of ingredients or is the product a single ingredient food?

questions.text: are ingredients in descending order of proportion by weight?
have the ingredients been declared using an appropriate common name?
have components been properly declared where required?
have sugars-based ingredients that are required to be grouped after the term 'Sugars' been properly declared?
are priority allergens, gluten and added sulphites declared using the prescribed source name or common names, as required?
sub_questions: in the list of ingredients, or
in a 'contains' statement?

questions.text: are priority allergens present due to unintended cross-contamination and listed in a cross-contamination statement?
is the 'contains' statement and/or cross contamination statement, if present, at the end of the list of ingredients?
if the product contains aspartame, is the phenylalanine statement present?
sub_questions: is it located at the end of the list of ingredients?

questions.text: if the statements are present, are they in the proper order of the phenylalanine statement, followed by the 'contains' statement, followed by the cross-contamination statement?
are the English and French lists of ingredients, phenylalanine statement and allergen declarations the same?

name_and_address.title: Name and Principal Place of Business

questions.text: is a name and principal place of business present, to the level of detail required?
sub_questions: if not, is the product exempt from declaring name and principal place of business?

questions.text: Canadian name and principal place of business, grouped with the geographic origin, or preceded by the expressions 'Imported by / importé par' or 'Imported for / importé pour'?
sub_questions: or, foreign name and principal place of business is identified?

questions.text: is the information on any label panel except solely on the bottom (except ornamental containers)?
are type height requirements of 1.6 mm (1/16 inch) or greater are met?
sub_questions: or, if the area of the principal display surface (PDS) is 10 cm2 (1.55 inches2) or less, is the minimum type height 0.8 mm (1/32 inch)?

questions.text: is it in English or French?
is a 'best before' date required?
sub_questions: if so, is it present?

questions.text: is the correct wording 'best before' / 'meilleur avant' used in English and French (or in one language if exempt from bilingual labelling)?
is the wording grouped with the date or does it clearly explain the date if located elsewhere on the label?
is the presentation of the date acceptable (order of info (year, month, day), use of bilingual symbols for months)?
is the location of the date acceptable (anywhere on the label, including the bottom if a reference is made elsewhere on the label indicating the date is present on the bottom)?
is a 'packaged on' date required?
sub_questions: if so, is it present?

questions.text: is the correct wording 'packaged on' / 'empaqueté le' used (or in one language if exempt from bilingual labelling)?
is the wording grouped with the date or does it clearly explain the date if located elsewhere on the label?
is the presentation correct as described above?
is location of the date acceptable as described above?
are storage instructions required?
sub_questions: if so, are they present and complete?

questions.text: is an 'expiration date' required?
sub_questions: if so, is it present?

questions.text: is the location of the date acceptable (anywhere on the label, including the bottom if a reference is made elsewhere on the label indicating the date is present on the bottom)?
is all of the above information readily discernible?
is an NFt present?
sub_questions: if not, is the product prohibited from using a NFt or exempt from NFt? (or has an NFt been triggered?)
if not, does the label have an available display surface (ADS) of less than 15 cm2, therefore being exempt from the need to carry an NFt?
if not, does the product qualify for the small package (ADS of less than 100 cm2) exemption? (postal address or toll-free number)

questions.text: is the NFt on the outer package?
sub_questions: not destroyed when product is opened? (except for single-serving containers)
on one continuous surface of the ADS?
placed so that product will not leak or be damaged in order to view the NFt?

questions.text: is the appropriate format family used?
sub_questions: standard format: all foods and certain assortments
simplified format: 6 or more of calories and core nutrients = 0
simplified format - single-serving prepackaged products
dual format: foods requiring preparation/different amounts
aggregate format: different kinds/different amounts
infants 6 months of age or older but less than 1 year of age

questions.text: is an appropriate format version (size) chosen within a 'family' of formats?

is the serving size aligned with the regulated reference amount (RA)? Is it expressed using a household measure (HM) first, followed by the corresponding metric measure (MM) in parentheses, based on the food as sold?
sub_questions: if single-serving container, does the package contains less than 200% of the RA for that food, or can the quantity of food in the package be reasonably eaten by one person at a single eating occasion?

questions.text: are energy and the 12 core nutrients declared, unless conditions for use of simplified format and single-serving simplified format have been satisfied?
sub_questions: are any non-permitted nutrients declared?
are triggered nutrients declared?
have the correct units and % DV (percent Daily Value) been used, when permitted/required?
have amounts (absolute amounts and % DV) been rounded as per the rounding rules set out in the Regulations?
is the % Daily Value interpretative statement included in the NFt (when required in the applicable NFt figure used)?

questions.text: is the table background and print in the appropriate colours?
is the font and type sans serif?
sub_questions: regular or bold as required?
upper case / lower case as required?
with no crowding of characters?

questions.text: is the information in the correct order?
are the correct indenting and leading used?
is an FOP nutrition symbol present?
sub_questions: if not, is the product prohibited or exempt from displaying a nutrition symbol?
if not, are the amounts of saturated fat, sugars and/or sodium in the product less than the specified nutrient thresholds?

questions.text: is the nutrition symbol located on the PDP of the product?
sub_questions: if not, is it a scale-labelled product where the nutrition symbol is permitted on the PDS?
is it an ornamental container where the nutrition symbol is permitted on the bottom of the container?

questions.text: does the nutrition symbol meet the requirements for legibility, language and orientation?
does the nutrition symbol meet the required technical specifications?
is the nutrition symbol proportional to the PDS?
sub_questions: if not, does the product have a PDS > 250 cm2 and is only sold in the retail establishment where it is packaged and labelled by means of a sticker?

questions.text: is the product an assortment or a multi-pack where one or more of the foods require a nutrition symbol?
sub_questions: if so, is the nutrition symbol applied as directed?

questions.text: is all mandatory information referred to in this checklist in English and French, except the responsible person's name and address which may be in either French or English?
sub_questions: if not, does a bilingual exemption apply (prepackaged other than consumer prepackaged container destined to a commercial or industrial enterprise, specialty food, local food, test market food)?

questions.text: is the food permitted to be irradiated?
sub_questions: if so, is there a written statement such as 'irradiated' or 'treated with radiation' or 'treated by irradiation' and the international symbol?

questions.text: is the statement readily discernible?
is the international symbol on the principal display panel?
does the international symbol meet the minimum size requirements for the outer diameter?
are irradiated ingredients that constitute more than 10% of the final food identified in the list of ingredients as 'irradiated'?
is aspartame added to the prepackaged food?
sub_questions: if so, is a phenylalanine statement present?
does the statement appear at the end of the list of ingredients?
is the statement in bold type?

questions.text: is the product a table-top sweetener?
sub_questions: if so and aspartame, sucralose, acesulfame-potassium or neotame are present, is a statement of the sweetness per serving expressed in terms of the amount of sugar required to produce an equivalent degree of sweetness declared on the label, grouped with the list of ingredients?

questions.text: is the product one of the following?
sub_questions: wine and brandy
dairy products
honey
fish and fish products
fresh fruits or vegetables
shell egg and processed egg products
meat and poultry products
maple products
processed fruit or vegetable products

questions.text: if so, check the food-specific labelling requirements, as for some imported prepackaged products it is mandatory to state the country of origin. When required use the country of origin declaration 'Product of [Name the country of origin]'.
